reviewText: Star Wars The Clone Wars: The Complete Season Four is an exciting continuation of the Clone Wars series. reviewText: Wow! O.O I think this is by far the best season of The Clone Wars. I got into this a little late. I was aware it was on TV, but never got around to tuning into it. So, I originally started the series on Netflix and bought the DVDs as they came out. It's been a wild ride, and after picking up the first season after it had been out for a while, the other seasons were picked up the week they came out. And this has to be my favorite season. The R2/3PO adventures were probably the only ones that are my least favorite, but the rest of the season is so rock solid that it is phenomenal. I got this on 10/29 and have watched it twice so far. The whole Ventress storyline, the Maul storyline, all of it is awesome. Not too much bad to say other than what I said for season 3: Where's the extras? I kind of like the whole video commentary idea, but I wish they added the artwork books like they did for seasons 1 and 2. But, other than that, live it, love it! Vive The Clone Wars!!!

reviewText: Season 4 of Star Wars The Clone Wars, had its shining moments. From the reveal of the treacherous jedi general krell, to the rebirth of a beloved sith darth maul. This season adds even more conspiracy to the clone wars. A great arc with cad bane and obi-wan while undercover as another famed bounty hunter totally brought back the whole underground that we all love in the series. As i watch the show more and more, its become clear this show is getting less child friendly. Well maybe for the younger ones, but i'm sure fans from age 10 and up will love this season. We also get to see more of ahsoka and asajj ventress, with very important events happening to both characters, to further their progression for the end. Its all out war in season 4, and is fun from beginning to end. Another great addition to the star wars universe :)!!!!
summary: another great season, with even darker implications!!!

reviewText: I love the Clone Wars. It's not just a kids' series. I'm 16 and I love it, and any Star Wars fan should. Well, the show, not individual episodes. The animation is noticeably better this season, and opens with an underwater battle (Water is one of the hardest things to animate). It gets darker and more and more like Revenge of the Sith. But... it... yeah... Kind of goes the opposite way in terms of story. If you saw the front cover at the top of the page and the episode "Witches of the Mist" you know what I'm talking about. Star Wars writers seriously need to learn the definition of the word "DEATH." They revive just about every villain in some way, sometimes, like in this case, 3 TIMES! KEEP HIM DEAD. THERE'S NO WAY YOU CAN GET CUT (somewhere), FALL DOWN A (something)  AND LIVE! JESUS, LUCAS! LEARN WHAT THE WORD DEATH MEANS. Oh yeah, and the meaning of "Milking a dead rock." Come up with some new characters already. Oh yeah, you introduced Savage Opress. Only so you could reintroduce someone else whose name I'm not spoiling even though everyone who can see knows who it is.

reviewText: Clone Wars in season 4 continued to impress. This season was filled with several multi-episode story arcs. I found the first half of the season generally disappointing. The Mon Calamari arc didn't do any favors to Admiral Ackbar's character. The Umbaran battle arc has impressive visuals, but dragged on a bit long. I generally found the slaver's arc to be uninspired, with too many silly stereotypes (including an entire race of slaver's with Russian accents).The second half of the season really picked up the pace with Obi-Wan Kenobi's undercover arc. I loved seeing more of the bounty hunters, especially Cad Bane! There were some great moments foreshadowing Anakin Skywalker's downfall. Then, of course, the finale, with Asajj become a freelance agent, Boba Fett getting a helmet, and Darth Maul!Overall, this season definitely showed that the animators have the technical capability to do just about anything on the show. The second half of the season showed that the producers are willing to take the story into really dark and interesting places. I can't wait for season 5.

reviewText: It is another smashing season of "The Clone Wars"!!!  It introduces new allies, new villians, and resurrects old enemies.  The pacing is fast and furious, but never forgets to focus on these incredible characters.  Lucasfilm and Cartoonnetwork have be awesome to let us have these incredible episodes.  It is a shame that the series has come to an end.  I hope that Disney decides to continue producing this great entry into the "Star Wars" universe.
Title: N/A

reviewText: "Star Wars" fans are a fickle bunch. Some choose to believe only the original trilogy is to be taken seriously. Others are willing to accept all six of the films in the live-action series and that's all. I belong to the last group I'm about to talk about.The faction I belong to will devour anything Lucas and company delivers in regards to a "Galaxy Far, Far Away." We're happy to get anything that expands the universe we love so much. Individuals who fall into this category but don't have the luxury of cable, satellite television, or high speed internet connections can now celebrate in the news that Lucasfilm and Warner Bros. released "Star Wars: The Clone Wars - The Complete Season Four" on Bu-ray and DVD.Season Four of the show features the Jedi and Clone troopers continuing their tireless campaign to help different alien species fight for freedom against Battle Droids, Sith lords, and other deadly forces on strange worlds. Things get more complicated when a sinister enemy from the past returns to seek vengeance against Obi-Wan Kenobi. Darth Maul recruits the brutal Savage Opress in a scheme to kill the Jedi Knight for the wounds he inflicted on the Sith apprentice."Star Wars: The Clone Wars" was meant to be seen in high-definition and this delivers just that. Every vibrant color scheme on every exotic planet the Jedi and Clone troopers journey to in their battle with the evil Empire are amplified. The picture is clean and provides a flawless viewing experience without distractions. It's the perfect way for the vast CGI world of "The Clone Wars" to be taken in. It's amazing how beautifully textured the landscapes and exteriors and interiors of the spaceships look. The animators and creative team really have moved forward light years since the beginning of the series in 2008.A 5.1 surround sound mix ensures that no home theater audiences will miss a single buzzing lightsaber, blasting laser rifle, or speeding starship that crosses the television screen. Kevin Kiner's musical score adds an emotional depth to each episode. It takes the familiar pieces of John Williams' original compositions and expands on them to give the series its own unique atmosphere. The dialogue blends well within the framework of the sound effects and soundtrack as well.Bonus material for the set includes five video commentaries with the director, cast, and crew of the show. An all-encompassing database of early test animation, concept art, and 3D turnarounds are featured. There's also a collectible "Wanted" poster with Cad Bane and other bounty hunters."Star Wars: The Clone Wars - The Complete Season Four" is all the proof you need that this excellent show deserves your attention and respect. It's improved both visually and in story quality over the past few years. Long-time enthusiasts will be happy to know many beloved characters new and old show up including Count Dooku, General Grievous, Jar Jar Binks, Boba Fett, and many more. It's a complex science fiction thrill ride that will keep you glued to your TV screen for hours.
summary: Blu-ray Review: "Star Wars: The Clone Wars - the Complete Season Four"

reviewText: Season One was decent, Season Two was great, and Season Three was quite weak.  THIS season however, exceeded expectations!  Unlike Seasons 2 and 3, this season ends on a cliffhanger note that leaves you wanting more, so I can't wait for Season Five.The beginning of the season is sadly weak however.  I found the Mon Cal trilogy to be boring and way too predictable, with no surprises really at all.  Shadow Warrior was a better episode, but again, there was nothing in that episode that made me believe it needed to be there.  Mercy Mission and Nomad Droids were also fun to watch, but pointless in the end.The Umbara arc however put the season on an amazing track, full of surprises, twists, and excellent characters and character development.  The last episode in the arc, Carnage of Krell is one of my favorite episodes!Unfortunately, a great arc led to a weak arc, with the Zygerrian slavers.  I wasn't a big fan of the comic books based on this arc, and I wasn't a big fan of these episodes.  While Kidnapped and Slaves of Republic weren't terrible episodes, Escape from Kadova were one of my least favorite episodes this season.The stand alone episode A Friend in Need on the other hand, was excellent.  It was great to see Pre Vizla again, and the situation has changed with the Death Watch.  The end of the episode left me wanting to see more of them.But alas, the writers keep us waiting by bringing in a different storyline that will change the way you viewed Anakin's sudden turn to the dark side in Star Wars Ep III forever.  Deception and Friends and Enemies were excellent, The Box was a bit weak, but the arc stands strong with its wrap-up episode Crisis on Naboo.Then, finally, the season shifts it's attention back to Asajj Ventress, where she is thrown into a mess of an episode that felt like it was taking elements from Twilight, Harry Potter, and  Lord of the Rings.  Also (spoiler alert), this episode has zombies in it.  Yes.  Though this isn't really new to fans who have read Death Troopers and Red Harvest, both of them being star wars zombie novels, this is a big surprise for a series that's supposedly aimed for kids.Then, the season goes from mystical, magical chaos, to old-fashioned bounty hunter action called Bounty, which is an entertaining but poorly-written episode.  Then there's Brothers, where we see Darth Maul return, and man did Sam Whitwer do an excellent job doing the Sith Lord's voice!  Though Brothers was a tedious start, the season wraps up with an excellent finale Revenge, where we are left with so much debate as to what's going to happen next.  It should be fun to the finish!One more thing, the animation is so-well done this season.  It's unpredictable what they will do, and this season was just one surprise to the next!  I can't wait to own this set!

reviewText: I am a big fan of the series and have been watching since the beginning.  Even if you watched the series in HD on TV you haven't truly experienced it.  The Blu-ray brings out the sound and picture to whole new levels.  Season four has darker undertones than past seasons.  The series is starting to draw closer in the timeline to Anakin's fall and the Empire's birth in Episode 3, Revenge of the Sith.The season starts off with a multi-episode story on Mon Calamari.  Decent story arc, but the highlight is a younger Ackbar, as only a General not yet an Admiral. Next they introduce the most annoying Jedi ever, General Krell, and you will dislike him intensely. Fortunately he is dealt with eventually.  This four episode story arc has a lot of battles featuring the clones and the 'Shadow People'.  A nice change from the constant droid armies although droids are included in their army to a lesser degree.  The 'Shadow People' introduce some new monstrous machines to the Star Wars universe.The second half of the season finishes strong with Obi Wan taking the guise of a bounty hunter to uncover an assassination plot involving Cade Bane.  Obi Wan undergoes extensive facial reconstruction and an implanted voice chip to alter his speech.  Apparently, in the Star Wars universe one can have massive face surgery in a matter of hours with no scars and then eventually change back rather easily a few weeks later.  Anyway, the season ends strong with the return of Darth Maul.  Darth Maul looks kind of goofy with his reconstructed body with a new spider torso.  Maul teams up with his brother Savage Opress to take revenge on Obi Wan who sliced him in half in Episode I, Phantom Menace.  Savage Opress also goes against Asajj Ventress.  Ventress has improved as a character since Dooko dropper her as apprentice as she is only looking out for he own interests.The season includes all the major characters including Grievous, Rex and other clones, R2 and C-3PO, young Boba Fett and more.  If you enjoy the series this is an easy decision, buy it.

reviewText: 3 Big Faults!ONELack of Space Battles!Space Battles are great aren't they.They are the highlight of every space opera for me, and lots of people. Episodes with a space battle are always the highest ranking most viewed ones.Sadly in 2012 there weren't any......in any series....what a downer.Clone Wars could have cornered the market on exciting strategic space combat. Instead we get about 42 seconds of space battle in one episode.....and thats it.Kind of MASSIVELY dissapointing.You know Star Wars is famous for its space battles, in 6 films there are 4 of them, and the others at least have a chase sequence.This series doesn't even have those.And if anyone says "that undersea stuff was kind of like a space battle". Feel free to compare the ending of the GIJOE film with the space battle in Mass Effect 3.The previous season had 3 episodes with space battles and season 4 tops that with 1 short one. Thats pathetic and a complete misunderstanding of what the audience wants.Don't get me wrong, it doesn't have to be all space battles. But its like a chocolate chip cookie, and the space battles are the chips.So we were sold a chocolate cookie with one small chip. Which doesn't make me want another one.TWOThe Slaves of the Republic story is COMPLETELY copied from a comic book story. Except they changed the aliens for no reason (probably hard to cgi).THREESPOILER ALERT!!!!!!!!!.Darth Maul, who has gotten some impressive real estate on the cover. Is in the DVD, "as himself" lets say, for 10 WHOLE MINUTES.I kind of though he was the epic bad guy of the series based on the cover! He'd be like Dooku, and every other episode is about him.Nope, thats probably next series, and what so you put on the cover then?His shadow?Just his head?Why not "Lara Croft" him and just show the Torso.Also, its not the same voice actor.SPOILER ALERT ENDS.Sadly I'm not looking forward to the next season.
summary: 1 short space battle, copied story & very little Darth Maul

reviewText: While we see another season of Separatist fighting and the heroic Republic soldiers and brave Jedi continue their stand you'll also see more of the inner Darkness that's inside Anakin as he grapples with his own history during a mission and shows the possible final fate that awaits him. The series tries to keep an equal measure of action and censored lightness to the series so not to many parents groups are censorship departments come bearing down on them as they keep the series a focused medium for the younger generation as well as longtime fans of the franchise as well.  A lot of people have mixed feelings on the CGI animation but if you're willing to give them some leeway you'll see that it doesn't detract from the entertainment of the series at all.  The series season will give many fans what they want for the most part action and jed/sith lightsaber battles to keep us enamored until the next season...
summary: Season Four Shows Us The Darker Fate Anakin Is Destined For

reviewText: This season is really where the show came into its own. The storylines show more confidence, more complexity, and greater emotion. The animation is absolutely stellar for a television series, and comparable to many feature films.Of course, the big deal is the return of Darth Maul, and that was something I wasn't looking forward to. I thought it was silly to bring him back, just useless fan service. It ended up being handled very well. Maul's return effects many characters, including Obi-Wan, Ventress and Savage. It wasn't "look how cool, Maul's back!" there were repurcussions, and the character is very different. It was a great story to take on, and continued to be compelling in season 5.The set is packed with features and all the episodes look great in full widescreen.

reviewText: The Clone Wars Box Sets are a lot of fun - continuing the saga in an animated fashion, the series is a must-see for Star Wars fans. Beyond that, it is nice to have each season neatly packaged. The earlier season box sets were more impressive from that standpoint, with sturdier cases, but the current packages are adequate and the content is sufficient.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This collection of Star Wars  cartoons are very  well priced and will be enjoyed by fans of all ages.  My grandson  and husband both enjoyed it.
summary: A great  collection of Star Wars cartoons
Title: N/A

reviewText: more Darth maul if you love Darth Maul this is for you. Season four of five. with Disney owning Lucas films these might own day be hard to come by.
summary: Darth Maul on the cover Darth Maul in blu ray
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am a huge fan of the Clone Wars series, but was really disappointed with its fourth season. We see little of the main characters, and the arc-stories with other characters is distracting. This season does not advance the overall Clone Wars story until the final two episodes. And although the production is stunning, Clone Wars season 4 was personally not one of my favorites.
Title: N/A

reviewText: My kids love these DVDs.  They are a lot of fun and this case (compared to the original season 1 set) actually holds the DVDs well.  Fun show for everyone 6 and older who loves Star Wars.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I managed to keep up with the airing of these great shows up until the halfway point of this season. Not having cable took away some fun t.v time. Owning this set has caught me back up to this point, but must wait for the 5th later this year.
Title: N/A

reviewText: There is a four episode story arc involving the clones and a replacement general which is fantastic!  I think LucasFilms crew went all out on these episodes; they're fearfully engrossing.  I can't wait to finish off the rest of the season.
summary: I've not finished watching the whole season yet, and this is fantastic.
Title: N/A
